member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.IsEmpty
member.summary:
This property overrides its property in the base class by watching the feature count in editShapesLayer.
If it is empty, we can skip drawing it for better performance.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the EditInterativeOverlay.
member.remarks:
This method draws a representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.SetSelectedControlPoint(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape,System.Double)
member.summary: This protected method sets the control point.
member.returns: Returns true if control points are found and set correctly, otherwise returns false.
member.exception: If you pass a null as the targetPointShape, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
If you pass a minus value for the tolerance, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
member.param: This parameter is the target point shape we will edit.
This parameter is the search tolerance used when searching for the control point.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.SetSelectedControlPointCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape,System.Double)
member.summary: This protected virtual method is the Core method of the SetSelectedControlPoint API.
member.returns: A feature that represents the selected control point.
member.exception: If you pass a null as the targetPointShape, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
If you pass a minus value for the tolerance, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
member.param: This parameter is the target point shape we will edit.
This parameter is the search tolerance to use when searching for the control point.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.EndEditing(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape)
member.summary: This method ends the interative editing on the feature in the EditShapesLayer. You can override its logic by rewriting its core method.

members.member:
This is the method used to Drag a feature.
///
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DragFeatureCore.
As this is a concrete public method that wraps a Core method, we reserve the right to add events and other logic to pre- or post-process data returned by the Core version of the method. In this way, we leave our framework open on our end, but also allow you the developer to extend our logic to suit your needs. If you have questions about this, please contact our support team as we would be happy to work with you on extending our framework.
If you pass a null as the sourceControlPoint, we will throw an ArgumentNullException. If you pass a null as the targetControlPoint, we will throw an ArgumentNullException. This parameter specifies the source feature to be dragged. This parameter specifies the source control point used to drag the feature. This parameter specifies the target control point used to drag the feature. Returns a dragged feature.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.DragFeatureCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.Feature,ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape,ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape)
member.summary: This is the Core method of DragFeature which encapsulates the logic.
member.exception: If you pass a null as the sourceControlPoint, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
If you pass a null as the targetControlPoint, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
member.param: This parameter specifies the source feature to be dragged.
This parameter specifies the source control point used to drag the feature.
This parameter specifies the target control point used to drag the feature.

This is the method used to add vertex to a feature.
///
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method AddVertexCore.
As this is a concrete public method that wraps a Core method, we reserve the right to add events and other logic to pre- or post-process data returned by the Core version of the method. In this way, we leave our framework open on our end, but also allow you the developer to extend our logic to suit your needs. If you have questions about this, please contact our support team as we would be happy to work with you on extending our framework.
If you pass a null as the targetPointShape, we will throw an ArgumentNullException. If you pass a negative value for searchingTolerance, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException. This parameter specifies the point shape in which to search for the vertex. This parameter specifies the search tolerance used when searching for the vertex. True if add vertex succeeded, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.EditInteractiveOverlay.AddVertexCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.Feature,ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.PointShape,System.Double)
member.summary: This is the Core method of AddVertex which encapsulates the logic.
member.exception: If you pass a null as the targetPointShape, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
If you pass a negative value for searchingTolerance, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
member.param: This parameter specifies the target vertex to be added.
This parameter specifies the search tolerance used when searching for the vertex.
This parameter specifies the target feature that the vertex will be added to.
member.returns: Returns a feature with vertex added.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.ExtentInteractiveOverlay.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the ExtentInteractiveOverlay.
member.remarks:
This method draws the representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.

member.summary: This class inherits from Overlay abstract class. This specified overlay describes the interative process with the MapControl using the Mouse or Keyboard.

member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse button is pressed (down) on the Map.

member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse is moved on the Map.

member.name: E:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.InteractiveOverlay.MapMouseUp
member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse button is released (up) on the Map.

member.name: E:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.InteractiveOverlay.MapMouseClick
member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse button is clicked (mouse up and mouse down in the same postion) on the Map.

member.name: E:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.InteractiveOverlay.MapMouseDoubleClick
member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse button is double-clicked on the Map.

member.name: E:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.InteractiveOverlay.MapMouseWheel
member.summary: This event will be fired when the Mouse wheel is scrolled while the cursor is over the Map.

member.name: E:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.InteractiveOverlay.MapKeyDown
member.summary: This event will be fired when the key is pressed down when focusing on the Map.

code.title: C# Winforms Sample
code.description: This code snippet shows how to use MapKeyDown event for WinformsMap.

code.title: C# Wpf Sample
code.description: This code snippet shows how to use MapKeyDown event for WpfMap.

code.title: VB Winforms Sample
code.description: This code snippet shows how to use MapKeyDown event for WinformsMap.

example.code:
AddHandler winformsMap1.ExtentOverlay.MapKeyDown, AddressOf ExtentOverlay_MapKeyDown
Private Sub ExtentOverlay_MapKeyDown(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As MapKeyDownInteractiveOverlayEventArgs) Dim key As String = e.InteractionArguments.Key System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(key & " key is down.") End Sub

This method is the concrete wrapper for its virtual Core method.
As this is a concrete public method that wraps a Core method, we reserve the right to add events and other logic to pre- or post-process data returned by the Core version of the method. In this way, we leave our framework open on our end, but also allow you the developer to extend our logic to suit your needs. If you have questions about this, please contact our support team as we would be happy to work with you on extending our framework.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TrackInteractiveOverlay.TrackMode
member.summary: Gets a mode of TrackOverlay.
member.remarks: The default mode is TrackMode.None, which means you cannot draw or edit features at the client side. By setting the mode to TrackMode.Point, TrackMode.Line, TrackMode.Polygon, etc., you can add points, lines or polygons to the FeatureOverlay. Setting the mode to TrackMode.Edit lets you edit the shapes at the client side.
member.value: A mode of TrackOverlay.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TrackInteractiveOverlay.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the TrackInteractiveOverlay.
member.remarks:
This method draws the representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.

members.member:
This class is keep consistent with the base class MouseEventArgs.
Provides data for the WinformsMap or WpfMap's MapClick event.
The MapClick event occurs when you click the mouse button on the map, without dragging (i.e., without moving the mouse between pressing the button down and releasing it).

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Double,System.Double,ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapMouseButton)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WinformsMapClickEventArgs class.
member.param: The button of the mouse used during the generating mouse event.
The X screen coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.
The Y screen coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.
The X world coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.
The Y world coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.ScreenX
member.summary: Gets the screen X coordinate of the position clicked.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.ScreenY
member.summary: Gets the screen Y coordinate of the position clicked.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.WorldX
member.summary: Gets the X world coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.WorldY
member.summary: Gets the Y world coordinate of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.MouseButton
member.summary: Gets the mouse button used when the mouse click event is fired.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapClickWinformsMapEventArgs.WorldLocation
member.summary: Gets the location in world coordinates of the mouse cursor during the generating mouse event.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapDoubleLeftClickMode
member.summary: This enumeration specifies the behavior that occurs when double-left-clicking on the MapControl. The default value is ZoomIn.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapDoubleLeftClickMode.Default
member.summary: Default value (ZoomIn) of the enumeration.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapDoubleLeftClickMode.ZoomIn
member.summary: This enumeration item means that the map will ZoomIn when a double-left-click occurs.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MapDoubleLeftClickMode.Disabled
member.summary: This enumeration item means that the ZoomIn functionality for double-left-clicks will be disabled.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TilesExistingType
member.summary: This enumeration specifies the existence status for the current extent tiles.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TilesExistingType.NoneExisting
member.summary: No tiles exist. Rendering of tiles to the screen will be skipped.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TilesExistingType.PartExisting
member.summary: Some of the tiles exist and will be rendered to the screen; other areas will be submitted for drawing.

member.name: F:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TilesExistingType.AllExisting
member.summary: All tiles exist and will be rendered to screen; none will be submitted for drawing.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap
member.summary: The Map Control used to develop a Winforms application.

remarks.para: It is very important that the property MapUnit is set properly according to the unit of the data (Layers) represented in it. The MapUnit will allow the scale, distance and area calulations to work properly. In the vast majority of cases, the MapUnit will be DecimalDegrees, Meters or Feet; the default MapUnit is DecimalDegrees. A Map has an Overlays property used to set a group of Overlays (which can be thought as a group of data), or you can have your own overlays if you want to customize the overlays. To refresh the entire map, use the Refresh method. To refresh only one particular Overlay, use the Redraw method. There are two ways to control the Map: One way is to react to the user's mouse and keyboard (i.e., Shift when TrackZoomIn) actions, and the other way is to use the API provided by the Map Control to change the CurrentExtent and then Refresh or Redraw the Map.

example.code:
winformsMap1.MapUnit = GeographyUnit.DecimalDegree winformsMap1.MapBackground.BackgroundLayer = New BackgroundLayer(New GeoSolidBrush(GeoColor.GeographicColors.ShallowOcean))
Dim worldLayer As New ShapeFileFeatureLayer("..\..\SampleData\Data\Countries02.shp") worldLayer.ZoomLevelSet.ZoomLevel01.DefaultAreaStyle = AreaStyles.Country1 worldLayer.ZoomLevelSet.ZoomLevel01.ApplyUntilZoomLevel = ApplyUntilZoomLevel.Level20
Dim staticOverlay As New LayerOverlay() staticOverlay.Layers.Add("WorldLayer", worldLayer) winformsMap1.Overlays.Add(staticOverlay)
winformsMap1.CurrentExtent = New RectangleShape(-143.4, 109.3, 116.7, -76.3)
winformsMap1.Refresh()

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.CurrentExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the current extent of the MapControl.
member.remarks: The current extent represents the extent of the map's current position. This is a very important metric used to calculate the map's scale.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.ZoomLevelSet
member.summary: This property gets or sets the ZoomLevelSet used for the MapControl.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.MapResizeMode
member.summary: This property gets or sets the MapResizeMode to be used when resizing the MapControl.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.MaximumScale
member.summary: This property will gets or sets the MaximumScale your MapControl can zoom out to when your ZoomLevelSnappingMode is set to None.
member.remarks: If your ZoomLevelSnappingMode is set to Default or SnapUp, the maximum scale you can zoom out to will always be the maximum level from the 20 preset scales. If the MaximumScale value you set here is larger than the largest scale available in the preset scales, the next preset that is smaller than your MaximumScale will be chosen.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.MinimumScale
member.summary: This property gets or sets the MinimumScale your MapControl can zoom into when your ZoomLevelSnappingMode is set to None.
member.remarks: If your ZoomLevelSnappingMode is set to either Default or SnapUp, the minimum scale you can zoom into will always be the minimum level from the 20 preset scales. If the MinimumScale value you set here is larger than the smallest scale available in the preset scales, the next preset that is larger than your MinimumScale will be chosen.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.ThreadingMode
member.summary: This property gets or sets the ThreadingMode used in the MapControl.
member.remarks: Currently, we provide two different ThreadingModes: single-threaded mode and multi-threaded mode. The major difference for multi-threaded mode is that the drawing logic for overlays is done in another thread instead of the main thread.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.SmoothingMode
member.summary: This property returns or sets the rendering quality for the drawing canvas.

remarks.para: This property is used for GDI+ drawing. The explanation below is from the GDI+ documentation.

The smoothing mode specifies whether lines, curves, and the edges of filled areas use smoothing (also called antialiasing). One exception is that path gradient brushes does not obey the smoothing mode. Areas filled using a PathGradientBrush are rendered the same way (aliased) regardless of the SmoothingMode property.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: This property returns or sets the rendering mode for text associated with this GeoCanvas.

remarks.para:
This property is used for GDI+ drawing. The explanation below is form the GDI+ documentation.
The text rendering hint specifies whether text renders with antialiasing.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.CompositingQuality
member.summary: This property returns or sets the quality level to use during compositing.

remarks.para:
This property is used for GDI+ drawing. The explanation below is form the GDI+ documentation
Compositing is done during rendering when the source pixels are combined with the destination pixels to produce the resultant pixels. The quality of compositing directly relates to the visual quality of the output and is inversely proportional to the render time. The higher the quality, the slower the render time. This is because the higher the quality level, the more surrounding pixels need to be taken into account during the composite. The linear quality setting (AssumeLinear) compromises by providing better quality than the default quality at a slightly lower speed.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.DrawingQuality
member.summary: This property returns the drawing quality when rendering on the GeoCanvas.
member.remarks: The DrawingQuality specifies if BaseLineShapes, BasePointShapes, and BaseAreaShapes use anti-alias methods or other techniques that control the quality. In some cases you may want a higher quality rendering and in other cases higher speed is more desirable. It is up to the implementer of the derived GeoCanvas class to control exactly what this setting means.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh
member.summary:
This API will refresh all of the overlays. This overload's logic is slightly different from other overloads in that it will clear the screen bitmaps and will not delete the tiles if they already exist.
If you only want to refresh certain specified overlays, please use the other overloads and pass them into it.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay)
member.summary:
This API will refresh only one specified overlay. This overload has the same logic as the overloads that accept a group of overlays, but is different from overloads that do not accept parameters.
It will delete any tiles that already exist for the specified overlay and will keep the screen bitmaps for other overlays.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.RectangleShape)
member.summary: This API will refresh only sepcified area.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.RectangleShape,ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay)
member.summary: This API will refresh only sepcified area for one specified overlay.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay})
member.summary:
This API will refresh only the specified overlays. This overload has the same logic as the overloads that accept a single specified overlay, but is different from overloads that do not accept parameters.
It will delete any tiles that already exist for the specified overlays and will keep the screen bitmaps for other overlays.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WinformsMap.Refresh(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.RectangleShape,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay})
member.summary: This API will refresh the specified Area for the specified overlays.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.ZoomLevelSnappingMode
member.summary: This enumation provides the options used to set the ZoomLevel Snapping Mode. In SnapUp or Default mode, there are only 20 preset ZoomLevels whose scales are set accordingly with OpenLayers' scales. You can change this by setting the SnappingMode to None, but in doing so, you will lose the ability to use the TileCache system.

code.title: C# Sample
code.description: This code snippet shows how to set the ZoomLevel snapping mode to None.

example.code: winformsMap1.ZoomLevelSnapping = ZoomLevelSnappingMode.None;

example.code: winformsMap1.ZoomLevelSnapping =ZoomLevelSnappingMode.None

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay
member.summary: Serves as the base class that defines the properties and methods shared by all types of overlays.

remarks.para: The Overlay has a similar concept to that of the Layer. Different types of overlays stack over each other to form a map.
Usually, an overlay represents an image with a transparent background that is laid upon other overlay, such as a LayerOverlay or WmsOverlay.
There are basically two kinds of overlays: base overlays and non-base overlays.
A base overlay has its IsBase property set to true. It is displayed as the background image of the map.
A non-base overlay has a false IsBase property. These overlays can overlap the base overlay and/or each other.

member.remarks: The TileCache system is always used for better performance, especially in the case where your application tiles can be pregenerated.

code.title: C# sample
code.description: This code snippet shows you how to set a specified tile cache for the Overlay.

code.title: VB sample
code.description: This code snippet shows you how to set a specified tile cache for the Overlay.

example.code: Dim staticOverlay As New LayerOverlay() staticOverlay.Layers.Add("WorldLayer", worldLayer) staticOverlay.TileCache = New FileBitmapTileCache("C:\temp", "WorldOverlayTileCache")

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay.PreviewTileCache
member.summary: This property gets or sets the preview tile cache system. In order for this system to work, you must be in multi-threaded mode and have the tile cache set.
member.value: Returns tile caches used for preview.

code.title: C# sample
code.description: This code snippet shows you how to set a specified tile cache for previewTileCache in the Overlay.

code.title: VB sample
code.description: This code snippet shows you how to set a specified tile cache for preview in the Overlay.

example.code: winformsMap1.ThreadingMode = MapThreadingMode.Multithreaded Dim staticOverlay As New LayerOverlay() staticOverlay.Layers.Add("WorldLayer", worldLayer) staticOverlay.TileCache = New FileBitmapTileCache("C:\temp", "WorldOverlayTileCache") staticOverlay.PreviewTileCache = New FileBitmapTileCache("C:\temp", "WorldOverlayPreviewCache")

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay.Draw(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the Overlay.

remarks.para:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
As this is a concrete public method that wraps a Core method, we reserve the right to add events and other logic to pre- or post-process data returned by the Core version of the method. In this way, we leave our framework open on our end, but also allow you the developer to extend our logic to suit your needs. If you have questions about this, please contact our support team as we would be happy to work with you on extending our framework.

member.exception: If you pass a null as the canvas, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object to draw on.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay.DrawException(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Exception)
member.summary: This method will draw on the canvas when an exception occurs during the drawing process.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object to draw on.
This parameter is the exception that is occurring.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay.DrawExceptionCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Exception)
member.summary: This method is the Core method of DrawException, which can be overridden if you want to change its logic. This method will draw on the canvas when an exception occurs during drawing process.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object to draw on.
This parameter is the exception that is occurring.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.Overlay.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the Overlay.
member.remarks:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MarkerStyle
member.summary: This class represents the base class for all classes that defines the styles applied to the markers.
member.remarks: The MarkerStyle class is the base class for all style classed that contains the style definition of markers. When dynamicly creating the markers, these style classes apply their styles to markers. The MarkerStyle class has an abstract GetMarkers method which accepts a collection of features. It creates a collection of markers with the styles specified from these features. Inherit from this class and implements the GetMarkers method if you want to create your own MarkerStyle.

member.summary: Initialize an instance of the MarkerStyle class.

member.returns: A collection of marker controls that will be overlap on the map control.
member.param: A collection of features that the markers are created from.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MarkerZoomLevel
member.summary: This class defines styles of markers and a zoomlevel range. When the current zoomlevel is in that range, the styles will be applied to the markers.
member.remarks: This class defines how features will be marked based on its scale. Inside of the ZoomLevelSet there are a number of marker zoomlevels. We will determine which MarkerZoomLevel to use based on which one has the Scale property closest to the current scale. The matching one will define the styles that will be used to mark the features on the map.

member.name: T:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.MarkerZoomLevelSet
member.summary: This class represents a collection of MarkerZoomLevel that determines the appearance of markers at different zoomlevels.

remarks.para: This class represents a collection of MarkerZoomLevel. Each MarkerZoomLevel has a different scale and style definition which will be applied to markers when it is the current zoomlevel.
The MarkerZoomLevelSet decides which zoomlevel applys its styles to the markers base on the current zoomlevel.
If current zoomlevel is level 03 and we defined the styles on zoomlevel as below:
then no zoomlevel will apply styles to the markers. There will be no markers display on the screen.

When we change the current zoomlevel to level 04, now current zoomlevel falls into the zoomlevel range (04-10) that defines styles. The ZoomlevelSet will apply the styles on the zoomlevel 04 to the markers.

remarks.para: When you add custom zoomlevels to the CustomZoomLevels collection, the default ZoomLevel01-20 will be disabled. The zoomLevels in the CustomZoomLevels are matched with the scales defined in the Map.ZoomLevelScales. For example,
CustomZoomLevels[0] has the scale that equals to Map.ClientZoomLevelScales[0].

member.param: This parameter is the canvas object to draw on.
member.returns: The tile existing type, which indicates whether any tiles exist.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryOverlay.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws the WorldMapKitDesktopOverlay.
member.remarks:
This method draws the representation of the overlay based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryOverlay.DrawExceptionCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Exception)
member.summary: This method will draw on the canvas when the layer.Draw throw exception and the DrawExceptionMode is set to DrawException instead of ThrowException.
member.param: The target canvas to draw the layer.
The exception thrown when layer.Draw().

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If you use the CustomOverlays collection you may not at the same time use the following properties: StaticOverlay, DynamicOverlay. CustomOverlays was designed to replace these so that you can implement as many overlays as you need in any order. Trying to use CustomerOverlays and one of the properties above is not allowed as there is not a definitive logical order we could draw them in. Please reference to the documentation of CustomOverlays property for more information..

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.GoogleMapsLayer.OpenCore
member.exception: In the event you attempt to call this method on a Layer which has already been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.summary: This method opens the Layer so that it is initialized and ready to use.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Open. The open method plays an important role, as it is responsible for initializing the Layer. Most methods on the Layer will throw an exception if the state of the Layer is not opened. When the map draws each layer, the layer will be opened as one of its first steps; then, after it is finished drawing with that layer, it will close it. In this way, we are sure to release all resources used by the Layer.
When implementing the abstract method, consider opening the FeatureSource or RasterSource. You will get a chance to close these in the Close method of the Layer.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.GoogleMapsLayer.CloseCore
member.summary: This method closes the Layer and releases any resources it was using.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Close. The close method plays an important role in the life cycle of the Layer. It may be called after drawing to release any memory and other resources that were allocated since the Open method was called.
If you override this method, it is recommended that you take the following things into account: This method may be called multiple times, so we suggest you write the method so that that a call to a closed Layer is ignored and does not generate an error. We also suggest that in the Close you free all resources that have been opened. Remember that the object will not be destroyed, but will be re-opened possibly in the near future.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.GoogleMapsLayer.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws the Layer.
member.remarks:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the layer based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.
This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.

member.summary: Get picture format string which will use for request url.
member.returns: Get picture format string which will use for request url.

member.summary: This method opens the Layer so that it is initialized and ready to use.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Open. The open method plays an important role, as it is responsible for initializing the Layer. Most methods on the Layer will throw an exception if the state of the Layer is not opened. When the map draws each layer, the layer will be opened as one of its first steps; then, after it is finished drawing with that layer, it will close it. In this way, we are sure to release all resources used by the Layer.
When implementing the abstract method, consider opening the FeatureSource or RasterSource. You will get a chance to close these in the Close method of the Layer.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldMapKitLayer.IsOpenCore
member.summary: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.decimalDegreesValue: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.remarks: Various methods on the Layer require that it be in an open state. If one of those methods is called when the state is not open, then the method will throw an exception. To enter the open state, you must call the Layer Open method. The method will raise an exception if the current Layer is already open.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldMapKitLayer.CloseCore
member.summary: This method closes the Layer and releases any resources it was using.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Close. The close method plays an important role in the life cycle of the Layer. It may be called after drawing to release any memory and other resources that were allocated since the Open method was called.
If you override this method, it is recommended that you take the following things into account: This method may be called multiple times, so we suggest you write the method so that that a call to a closed Layer is ignored and does not generate an error. We also suggest that in the Close you free all resources that have been opened. Remember that the object will not be destroyed, but will be re-opened possibly in the near future.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldMapKitLayer.DrawImage(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws image on the canvas with specified labelsInAllLayers
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on. This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.
This parameter is the labels in all layers.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldMapKitLayer.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws the Layer.
member.remarks:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the layer based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.
This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WmsRasterSource.OpenCore
member.summary: This method opens the RasterSource so that it is initialized and ready to use.
member.remarks:
This protected virtual method is called from the concrete public method Open. The Open method plays an important role, as it is responsible for initializing the RasterSource. Most methods on the RasterSource will throw an exception if the state of the RasterSource is not opened. When the map draws each layer, it will open the RasterSource as one of its first steps; then, after it is finished drawing with that layer, it will close it. In this way, we are sure to release all resources used by the RasterSource.
When implementing this abstract method, consider opening files for file-based sources, connecting to databases in the database-based sources and so on. You will get a chance to close these in the Close method of the RasterSource.
member.exception: In the event you attempt to call this method on a image source which has already been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WmsRasterSource.GetBoundingBoxCore
member.exception: In the event you attempt to call this method on a image source which has not been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.summary: This method returns the bounding box of the RasterSource.
member.returns: The bounding box of the RasterSource.
member.remarks: This method returns the bounding box of the RasterSource.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WmsRasterSource.GetImageCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Shapes.RectangleShape,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.exception: If you pass in a worldExtent that is invalid, we will throw an ArgumentNullException.
If you pass in a worldExtent that is invalid, we will throw an ArgumentException.
If you pass in a image width that is smaller than or equal to 0, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
If you pass in a image height that is smaller than or equal to 0, we will throw an ArgumentOutOfRangeException.
In the event you attempt to call this method on a image source which has not been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.remarks: This method is responsible for returning the image based on the parameters passed in. As the core version of this method is abstract, you will need to override it when creating our own RasterSource.
member.summary: This method returns an image based on the worldExtent and image width and height.
member.returns: This method returns an image based on the worldExtent and image width and height.
member.param: This parameter represents the worldExtent you want to draw.
This parameter represents the width of the image you want to draw.
This parameter represents the height of the image you want to draw.

remarks.para: We only support application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml type. We don't support UPDATESEQUENCE property.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TiledWmsLayer.OpenCore
member.exception: In the event you attempt to call this method on a Layer which has already been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.summary: This method opens the Layer so that it is initialized and ready to use.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Open. The open method plays an important role, as it is responsible for initializing the Layer. Most methods on the Layer will throw an exception if the state of the Layer is not opened. When the map draws each layer, the layer will be opened as one of its first steps; then, after it is finished drawing with that layer, it will close it. In this way, we are sure to release all resources used by the Layer.
When implementing the abstract method, consider opening the FeatureSource or RasterSource. You will get a chance to close these in the Close method of the Layer.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TiledWmsLayer.IsOpenCore
member.summary: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.decimalDegreesValue: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.remarks: Various methods on the Layer require that it be in an open state. If one of those methods is called when the state is not open, then the method will throw an exception. To enter the open state, you must call the Layer Open method. The method will raise an exception if the current Layer is already open.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TiledWmsLayer.CloseCore
member.summary: This method closes the Layer and releases any resources it was using.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Close. The close method plays an important role in the life cycle of the Layer. It may be called after drawing to release any memory and other resources that were allocated since the Open method was called.
If you override this method, it is recommended that you take the following things into account: This method may be called multiple times, so we suggest you write the method so that that a call to a closed Layer is ignored and does not generate an error. We also suggest that in the Close you free all resources that have been opened. Remember that the object will not be destroyed, but will be re-opened possibly in the near future.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TiledWmsLayer.DrawImage(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas)
member.summary: This method draws image on the canvas with specified labelsInAllLayers
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on. This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.TiledWmsLayer.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws the Layer.
member.remarks:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the layer based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.
This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.

member.summary: This method retures a value represents whether the currentExtent is within the passing in thresholds.
member.param: The RectangleShape represents the current extent.
The upper threshold for scale.
The lower threshold for scale.
The width of canvas which will use to draw.
The GeographyUnit represents map unit for currentExtent
This parameter is the dpi of the current extent.
member.returns: This method retures a value represents whether the currentExtent is within the passing in thresholds. If returns true, is within. otherwise out of thresholds.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryRasterLayer.OpenCore
member.exception: In the event you attempt to call this method on a Layer which has already been opened, it will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.summary: This method opens the Layer so that it is initialized and ready to use.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Open. The open method plays an important role, as it is responsible for initializing the Layer. Most methods on the Layer will throw an exception if the state of the Layer is not opened. When the map draws each layer, the layer will be opened as one of its first steps; then, after it is finished drawing with that layer, it will close it. In this way, we are sure to release all resources used by the Layer.
When implementing the abstract method, consider opening the FeatureSource or RasterSource. You will get a chance to close these in the Close method of the Layer.

member.name: P:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryRasterLayer.IsOpenCore
member.summary: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.decimalDegreesValue: This property returns true if the Layer is open and false if it is not.
member.remarks: Various methods on the Layer require that it be in an open state. If one of those methods is called when the state is not open, then the method will throw an exception. To enter the open state, you must call the Layer Open method. The method will raise an exception if the current Layer is already open.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryRasterLayer.CloseCore
member.summary: This method closes the Layer and releases any resources it was using.
member.remarks:
This abstract method is called from the concrete public method Close. The close method plays an important role in the life cycle of the Layer. It may be called after drawing to release any memory and other resources that were allocated since the Open method was called.
If you override this method, it is recommended that you take the following things into account: This method may be called multiple times, so we suggest you write the method so that that a call to a closed Layer is ignored and does not generate an error. We also suggest that in the Close you free all resources that have been opened. Remember that the object will not be destroyed, but will be re-opened possibly in the near future.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryRasterLayer.DrawImage(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws image on the canvas with specified labelsInAllLayers
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on. This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.
This parameter is the labels in all layers.

member.name: M:ThinkGeo.MapSuite.WinForms.WorldStreetsAndImageryRasterLayer.DrawCore(ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Drawing.GeoCanvas,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ThinkGeo.MapSuite.Styles.SimpleCandidate})
member.summary: This method draws the Layer.
member.remarks:
This method is the concrete wrapper for the abstract method DrawCore. This method draws the representation of the layer based on the extent you provided.
When implementing this abstract method, consider each feature and its column data values. You can use the full power of the GeoCanvas to do the drawing. If you need column data for a feature, be sure to override the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore and add the columns you need to the collection. In many of the styles, we add properties that allow the user to specify which field they need; then, in the GetRequiredColumnNamesCore, we read that property and add it to the collection.
member.param: This parameter is the canvas object or a GeoImage to draw on.
This parameter represents the labels used for collision detection and duplication checking.

These are not pixels but the same units as the 'extent' of the layer.
member.param: Index of the feature to request
Return geometies would be expanded as scale.
